turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2300 Arena.
turn.2: In January 2003, the Pennsylvania State Athletic Commission banned barbed wire and light tubes from professional wrestling matches in response to violent XPW and CZW events at the venue.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The building's ownership evicted XPW from the venue in February 2003 after the promotion failed to make lease payments.
turn.5: What happened after they evicted XPW?
turn.6: CZW resumed running shows at the venue in March 2003, with 3PW returning in November 2003.
turn.7: Did they change the name of the arena?
turn.8: The building's name was officially changed to New Alhambra Sports & Entertainment Center in 2004, and was later shortened to New Alhambra Arena in 2006 and Alhambra Arena in 2008. The name was suggested by J. Russell Peltz, who began co-promoting professional boxing cards at the venue with Joe Hand, Sr.
turn.9: When did they change the name?
turn.11: Why did they change the name?
turn.12: It paid homage to the original Alhambra Movie Theater in South Philadelphia that hosted boxing in the 1950s and 1960s.
